en: They assumed the victory as their own.

en: They do anything in order to win.

en: They won the day.

en: They won.

en: They made speeches in turn.

en: They were watching for the signal to start.

en: They are about to start.

en: They're about to leave.

en: They will cut down on their expenses.

en: They are beginning their homework.

en: They run like pigs from a gun.

en: They had no house to live in.

en: They like to get together and drink.

en: They are paid by the week.

en: They meet once a week.

en: They succeeded in getting that job.

en: They equate religion with church-going.

en: They set the prisoner at liberty.

en: They bound the prisoner's arms and legs.

en: They succeeded in catching the tiger alive.

en: They had a good hunt.

en: They kept on feeling their way.

en: They felt their way in the dark.

en: Are they writing a letter?

en: They went hand in hand.

en: They live in a rented house.

en: They have to repair their car.

en: They were lying on the grass.

en: They are struggling for freedom.

en: They died for the cause of liberty.

en: They fought for their liberty.

en: They boast of their bridge.

en: They make good use of their rooms.

en: It is important for them to do their best.

en: They started one after another.

en: They left one after another.

en: They got off at the next bus stop.

en: They came here one after another.

en: They visit us from time to time.

en: They have something in common.

en: They built an extension to the office.

en: They were apprehensive that the situation would worsen.

en: They are short of funds.

en: They ended capitalism and built a socialist society.

en: They were eager for the game to begin.

en: They failed in the examination.

en: They lost the game but observed the rules.

en: They know us.

en: They made me wait for a long time.

en: They were very kind to me.

en: They asked for my help.

en: They are pushing me for payment.

en: They asked me to make a speech at short notice.

en: They asked me to make a speech on short notice.

en: They were glad to see me.

en: They asked me for something to drink.

en: They require me to work harder.

en: They are very kind to me.

en: They forced me to take the medicine.

en: They charged me with the important task.

en: They didn't tell me so.

en: They asked me what my name was, where I came from, and why I had come.

en: They asked me to join the union of the company.

en: They kept us waiting outside for a long time.

en: They invited us around for a meal.
zh: 他们请我们过去吃饭。

en: They made us work all night.

en: They made us work all day long.
zh: 他们让我们干了一整天的活。

en: They had started earlier than us.

en: They had started earlier than we had.
zh: 他们起步比我们要早。

en: They are much taller than us.

en: They are jealous of our success.

en: They were sitting on the sofa in our living room.

en: They are very thick with our family.

en: They are the pupils of our school.

en: They are our dearest friends.

en: They supplied us with food.

en: They live in our block.

en: They like us to come and stay with them.

en: They won't allow us to enter the garden.

en: They don't allow us to go to disco.

en: They criticized me for coming late.

en: They were anxious I would help them.

en: They are all alike to me.

en: They insisted on my making use of the opportunity.

en: They insisted on my attending the meeting.
zh: 他们坚持要我参加会议。

en: They insisted on my paying the money.

en: They accused me of taking the money.

en: They were not aware that I was not there.

en: They insisted on my making use of this opportunity.

en: They are living on charity.

en: They have full confidence in their leader.

en: They demanded that the mayor should resign.

en: They are at work.

en: They got to business.

en: They got married last fall.

en: They arrived here safely yesterday.
